channel.title: Web-based item list (includes demo) (with item searching!)
channel.description:
Hey. I wrote a web-based item list that includes item searching. It lists 22 results per page and it has backwards and forwards page traversing. It has an installer and it allows for "close" matches (for example, if you type in Rune you will get Rune Longsword, Rune Platebody, Mind Rune, etc).
To install it, extract all the files from the .zip file into a folder. Then, modify the config.php to your site's database information and upload all the files (three .php files and one .sql file) to your site. Visit www.whatever.com/install.php and let it install. After the installation has finished, delete the install.php (this [b]must[/b] be done for security reasons) and if you like delete the install.sql file too (this isn't a necessity). After this, visit www.whatever.com/itemlist.php and have fun.
The itemlist.php file included in the download is [b]not[/b] styled! It took me around 2 minutes to integrate it into my site as in the demo and so it isn't hard. However, if anyone is having issues with it, feel free to PM me and I'll get round to helping.
[center][size=24pt]Demo[/size] [size=14pt]www.jamesmonger.com/itemlist.php [/size] [size=24pt]Download[/size] [size=14pt]www.jamesmonger.com/downloads/itemlist.zip[/size][/center]

item.title: Web-based item list (includes demo) (with item searching!)
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

KempiScape:

Thanks, but would it be a good idea to use the runescape itemdb(grand exchange) because of limited database size??

There’s only around 20,000 rows in the item database. There are 2,998,035 posts on the MoparScape forum, which means that there are 2,998,035 rows for posts only - 20,000 rows is not a lot

Read full topic

item.title: Web-based item list (includes demo) (with item searching!)
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“run3scap3_uk, post:6, topic:471047”]Nice, thankyou for sharing:)
Suggestion: How about adding a suggested item, in case someone doesn’t know how to spell the pacific item they’re looking for, so about 3 suggested items with around the same spelling appears.[/quote]
That would involve the use of JavaScript which I’m not too keen on using because it can result in breakages if the end user doesn’t have JavaScript enabled.

Read full topic
